creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: portion of a boat shown at L with man sitting on prow near lower center of image; buildings along opposite shore in middle ground with willow trees near L; another boat with silhouetted passengers near middle
inscription:
Signature

-- in graphite on verso: P 1711 | 76/77-[U or V?]6-RLW
medium: Etching and drypoint with plate tone
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 16, 1985, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed in graphite on tab at bottom edge, at left: [Theodore Roussel Imp]; signed in plate, lower right: [Theodore Roussel]
title: Battersea from Chelsea
